item.title: Jamie add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is hard enough to remember my opinions, without also remembering my reasons for them!" -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "Life has been some combination of fairy-tale coincidence and joie de vivre and shocks of beauty together with some hurtful self-questioning." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "When I looked at you, my life made sense. Even the bad things made sense. They were necessary to make you possible." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Haruki Marukami
item.description: "Whatever it is you're seeking won't come in the form you're expecting." -- Haruki Marukami

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "The pages are still blank, but there is a miraculous feeling of the words being there, written in invisible ink and clamoring to become visible" -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "Everything that irritates us about others can lead us to an understanding of ourselves." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Paulo Coelho
item.description: "Choosing a path meant having to miss out on others. She had a whole life to live, and she was always thinking that, in the future, she might regret the choices she made now. “I’m afraid of committing myself,” she thought to herself. She wanted to follow all possible paths and so ended up following none. Even in that most important area of her life, love, she had failed to commit herself. After her first romantic disappointment, she had never again given herself entirely. She feared pan, loss, and separation. These things were inevitable on the path to love, and the only way of avoiding them was by deciding not to take that path at all. In order not to suffer, you had to renounce love. It was like putting out your own eyes not to see the bad things in life." -- Paulo Coelho

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I have a theory that every time you make an important choice, the part of you left behind continues the other life you could have had." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "And you really will have to make it through that violent, metaphysical, symbolic storm. No matter how metaphysical or symbolic it might be, make no mistake about it: it will cut through flesh like a thousand razor blades. People will bleed there, and you will bleed too. Hot, red blood. You'll catch that blood in your hands, your own blood and the blood of others. And once the storm is over you won't remember how you made it through, how you managed to survive. You won't even be sure, in fact, whether the storm is really over. But one thing is certain. When you come out of the storm you won't be the same person who walked in. That's what this storm's all about." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Jeanette Winterson
item.description: "I knew it like destiny, and at the same time, I knew it as choice." -- Jeanette Winterson

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Anxiety is love's greatest killer. It makes others feel as you might when a drowning man holds on to you. You want to save him, but you know he will strangle you with his panic." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Jorge Luis Borges
item.description: "Being with you and not being with you is the only way I have to measure time." -- Jorge Luis Borges

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Douglas Adams
item.description: "The story so far: In the beginning the Universe was created. This has made a lot of people very angry and been widely regarded as a bad move." -- Douglas Adams

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Terry Pratchett
item.description: "Give a man a fire and he's warm for a day, but set fire to him and he's warm for the rest of his life." -- Terry Pratchett

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "The more that you read, the more things you will know. The more that you learn, the more places you'll go." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Once you make a decision, the universe conspires to make it happen." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "We all have such fateful objects -- it may be a recurrent landscape in one case, a number in another -- carefully chosen by the gods to attract events of specific significance for us: here shall John always stumble; there shall Jane's heart always break." -- Vladimir Nabokov

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Robert A. Heinlein
item.description: "Love is that condition in which the happiness of another person is essential to your own." -- Robert A. Heinlein

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Gabriel Garcia Marquez
item.description: "I discovered that my obsession for having each thing in the right place, each subject at the right time, each word in the right style, was not the well-deserved reward of an ordered mind but just the opposite: a complete system of pretense invented by me to hide the disorder of my nature. I discovered that I am not disciplined out of virtue but as a reaction to my negligence, that I appear generous in order to conceal my meanness, that I pass myself off as prudent because I am evil-minded, that I am conciliatory in order not to succumb to my repressed rage, that I am punctual only to hide how little I care about other people’s time. I learned, in short, that love is not a condition of the spirit but a sign of the zodiac." -- Gabriel Garcia Marquez

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Dr. Seuss
item.description: "You know you're in love when you can't fall asleep because reality is finally better than your dreams." -- Dr. Seuss

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "What makes the desert beautiful,' said the little prince, 'is that somewhere it hides a well..." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Zadie Smith
item.description: "And so it happened again, the daily miracle whereby interiority opens out and brings to bloom the million-petalled flower of being here, in the world, with other people. Neither as hard as she had thought it might be nor as easy as it appeared." -- Zadie Smith

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "All grown-ups were once children... but only few of them remember it." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
Jamie add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "I shall look at you out of the corner of my eye, and you will say nothing. Words are the source of misunderstandings." -from the Fox-" -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
item.description: "Well, I must endure the presence of a few caterpillars if I wish to become acquainted with the butterflies." -- Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "In the sunset of dissolution, everything is illuminated by the aura of nostalgia, even the guillotine." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "she loved to walk down the street with a book under her arm. It had the same significance for her as an elegant cane for the dandy a century ago. It differentiated her from others." -- Milan Kundera

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Milan Kundera
item.description: "To rebel against being born a woman seemed as foolish to her as to take pride in it." -- Milan Kundera
